thread.title: Around the NHL | Sharks top Devils to remain unbeaten - Columbus Dispatch
thread.title_full: Around the NHL | Sharks top Devils to remain unbeaten - Columbus Dispatch

title: Around the NHL | Sharks top Devils to remain unbeaten - Columbus Dispatch
text:
Blue Jackets | Training camp regimen Saturday October 17, 2015 5:48 AM 
Sharks 2, Devils 1, SO: Joe Pavelski and Brent Burns scored in the shootout, and visiting San Jose rode another big effort by goaltender Martin Jones in defeating winless New Jersey on Friday night. 
Jones stopped 31 shots and came within 3:38 of posting his third straight shutout as the Sharks posted their fourth straight victory under former New Jersey coach Pete DeBoer. They also kept the Devils winless at 0-3-1 under new coach John Hynes. 
DeBoer, who was fired by the Devils last season, is 4-0 with San Jose. 
>> Sign up for our free, daily newsletter on the Blue Jackets, get a chance to win tickets! 
Patrick Marleau scored for the Sharks in the opening minute and the goal stood until Adam Henrique tied the score on a power play with 3:38 to play in regulation. 
Hurricanes 5, Red Wings 3: Jordan Staal and Kris Versteeg each had a goal and two assists to help host Carolina hand Detroit its first loss of the season. Brock McGinn, playing on the line with Staal and Versteeg, added a goal and an assist in his NHL debut. 
Jets 3, Flames 1: Dustin Byfuglien got the go-ahead goal with 1:28 remaining and Blake Wheeler added an empty-net goal to help Winnipeg win its home opener. Notable 
• Tampa Bay Lightning defenseman Nikita Nesterov has been suspended for two games without pay for boarding Dallas Stars forward Curtis McKenzie. 
• Sharks center Logan Couture will have surgery on a broken right fibula and is expected to miss four to six weeks, the team said. In his seventh season with the Sharks, Couture has one assist and a plus-1 rating in three games. 
• Edmonton Oilers coach Todd McLellan was named coach of Team North America for the 2016 World Cup of Hockey. Team North America will consist of players from Canada and the United States who are age 23 or younger as of Oct. 1, 2016. Weekly Online Chats 
Each week (usually at 1 p.m. Wednesdays) during during the NHL season, Dispatch beat writer Aaron Portzline answers readers’ questions. Join us for our next Blue Jackets online chat or read the most recent chat transcript . Cannon Fodder Podcast 
Cannon Fodder is the podcast from The Dispatch sports team covering the Blue Jackets. Tune in for lively discussions about the ta and the rest of the NHL. Subscribe to the show through its RSS feed or iTunes . Commentary from the Dispatch
